catalog_info.title: Authority and Disobedience
catalog_info.description: This course examines the relationship between individuals and ‘governing agencies’—most prominently, the state—from an analytic political-theory perspective. The course is divided into two parts. Part I focuses on theories of legitimate political authority: it considers different answers to the question of what, if anything, grounds states’—and similar entities’—moral right to rule. Part II addresses the dilemmas raised by non-compliance with authority (topics covered might include civil disobedience, punishment, and revolution).
